ARABIC: وَلَمَّا ضُرِبَ ٱبْنُ مَرْيَمَ مَثَلًا إِذَا قَوْمُكَ مِنْهُ يَصِدُّونَ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: When an example is made of the son of Maryam your people laugh uproariously.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: When the example of Mary's son is quoted before them, your people cry out at it,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: No sooner the example of the son of Mary was mentioned than, lo and behold, your people raised a clamour
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: When the son of Mary was mentioned as an example, you people cried out in protest, saying,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: And when the example of the son of Maryam is given, your people laugh at it!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And when the son of Maryam is quoted as an example, behold, your people cry aloud thereat.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And when a description of the son of Marium is given, lo! your people raise a clamor thereat.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: And when the son of Mary is cited as an example, behold, thy people turn away from it
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: And when the son of Mary is quoted as an example, behold! the folk laugh out,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: When [Jesus] the son of Mary is held up as an example, your people raise an outcry on this,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And when the son of Maryam is held up, an example, behold! thy people thereat cry out.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: When the Son of Mary was cited as an example, behold, your people raise an outcry.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: When (Jesus) the son of Mary is held up as an example, behold, thy people raise a clamour thereat (in ridicule)!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And when the son of Maryam (Mary) is quoted as an example [i.e. 'Iesa (Jesus) is worshipped like their idols), behold! Your people cry aloud (laugh out at the example).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: When the son of Mary is mentioned as an example, your people turn away from it
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: And when the son of Mary was cited as an example, your people opposed.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And when the son of Mary was presented as an example, immediately your people laughed aloud.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [43:57] And when the son of Mary is cited as an example — after God’s [following] words were revealed: ‘Truly you and what you worship besides God shall be fuel for Hell’ [Q. 21:98] and the idolaters said, ‘We are satisfied that our gods be together with Jesus [in Hell], for he too was worshipped besides God’ — behold! your people, that is, the idolaters, laugh at it, at this example — they clamour with joy at what they hear.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (And when the son of Mary is quoted as an example) they likened him to their deities, (behold! the folk laugh out) upon hearing the words of 'Abdullah al-Zib'ari and his folk,
